articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple loud explosions were heard in several places in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday as India said it had attacked "terrorist infrastructure" in nine sites and Pakistan vowed to respond to the attacks.
articles.title: India says it attacked nine sites in Pakistan, Pakistani Kashmir

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Joshua McElwee, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Roman Catholic cardinals will begin the task of electing a new pope, locking themselves away from the world until they choose the man they hope can unite a diverse but divided global Church.
articles.title: Cardinals set to enter conclave to decide who follows Pope Francis

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli strikes on a school housing displaced families in northern Gaza killed 13 Palestinians, local health authorities said, as Israeli forces continued to demolish homes and buildings in Rafah in the south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 13 in Gaza school housing displaced families, medics say

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: The United States and Israel have discussed the possibility of Washington leading a temporary post-war administration of Gaza, according to five people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: US, Israel discuss possible US-led administration for Gaza, sources say

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: The Israeli military carried out an airstrike on Yemen's main airport in Sanaa on Tuesday, its second attack in two days on Iran-aligned Houthi rebels, after the group launched a missile attack near Israel's Ben Gurion Airport.
articles.title: Israel hits Yemen's main airport in airstrike against Houthis

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A federal appeals court has ordered President Donald Trump's administration to transfer a Tufts University student from Turkey, being held in a Louisiana immigration detention facility after engaging in pro-Palestinian advocacy, to be sent to Vermont for a judge to decide whether to release her on bail.
articles.title: Tufts student challenging immigration detention must be sent to Vermont, court rules

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish police said on Wednesday they had detained a man after he killed one person with an axe in an attack at Warsaw University.
articles.title: Polish police detain man after he kills one person with axe at Warsaw University

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: A nearly two-month-long U.S. bombing campaign in Yemen dealt heavy damage to the Iran-aligned Houthis but U.S. officials and experts caution that the group is expected to remain a vexing adversary despite a ceasefire announced on Tuesday by Washington.
articles.title: U.S. bombing dents but doesn't destroy Houthi threat in Yemen

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he would pursue the progressive lifting of European Union sanctions against Syria if Syria stuck to its current path, and added he would lobby the United States to also follow suit in this regard.
articles.title: France's Macron: will pursue progressive lifting of EU sanctions on Syria

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Trump's administration may deport migrants to Libya for the first time this week, three U.S. officials said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US may soon deport migrants to Libya on military flight, sources say
